title: Sexual Offense Evidence and Reporting Procedures Amendments
description: Sexual Offense Evidence and Reporting Procedures Amendments

House/ 1st reading (Introduced) in House Rules Committee

general_provisions: This bill amends evidence and reporting procedures that occur after a sexual offense is committed.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>amends injury reporting requirements for a health care provider for certain sexual offenses;<hr><ltbullet>allows certain victims of a sexual offense the option of:<hr><ltbullet1>receiving medical treatment, without any report of the sexual offense to law enforcement;<hr><ltbullet1>with or without medical treatment, providing either a full report or a limited report of the sexual offense to law enforcement;<hr><ltbullet1>allowing evidence collection for the sexual offense, including a sexual assault medical forensic examination that collects a sexual assault kit; and<hr><ltbullet1>designating the sexual assault kit as either an unrestricted kit with full disclosure and processing or as a restricted kit that can either be stored without testing or subjected to limited testing;<hr><ltbullet>requires limited victim information to be shared with law enforcement with a restricted kit;<hr><ltbullet>requires that payment of costs for medical treatment and evidence collection for a victim of a sexual offense be the same regardless of whether the victim opts to make a full or limited report to law enforcement or if the victim opts only for medical treatment without reporting the sexual offense to law enforcement;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Bureau of Forensic Services to conduct testing of certain restricted kits;<hr><ltbullet>requires the Department of Public Safety's statewide sexual assault kit tracking system to provide limited access to a victim who has submitted a restricted kit for forensic testing to track the kit's processing status;<hr><ltbullet>establishes procedures for contacting a victim through a victim advocate to request the victim's consent to certain disclosures if a law enforcement agency determines that:<hr><ltbullet1>there may be a serial sexual offender in a particular area; and <hr><ltbullet1>evidence in the victim's restricted kit may provide relevant evidence in the investigation;<hr><ltbullet>revises and reorganizes statutory procedures and requirements that occur after certain sexual offenses are committed;<hr><ltbullet>amends provisions to provide for a reparations award for a victim of a sexual assault under certain circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>amends the definition of "sexual offense" for certain sexual offense procedures and victim rights provisions;<hr><ltbullet>inserts the former definition of "sexual offense" into statutes that had relied on the definition of "sexual offense" that this bill amends; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
